class.name: CoordinateReferenceSystem

javadoc.text: * This class represents an arbitrary system of reference for which {@link Coordinates coordinates} of same significance can be stated.

class.class:
* This class represents an absolute position (can be be extended)
* Holds the Geodetic Latitude (WGS84 Ellipsoid).
<declaration type="Measurable" name="latitudeWGS84" />
* Holds the Geodetic Longitude (WGS84 Ellipsoid).
<declaration type="Measurable" name="longitudeWGS84" />
* Holds the WGS84 Ellipsoidal Height.
<declaration type="Measurable" name="heightWGS84" />
* Holds the Time since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.
<declaration type="Measurable" name="timeUTC" />
* Returns the converter between this coordinate reference system * and the one specified. that the coordinate reference system to convert to. the corresponding coordinates converter. ConversionException if the conversion is not possible * (e.g. geographic to temporal).
<method type="CoordinatesConverter" name="getConverterTo" startLine="78" endLine="80" />
<implements name="CoordinatesConverter" /> <declaration type="CoordinateReferenceSystem" name="_toCRS" />
* Returns the coordinates in this reference system of the specified * absolute position. position the absolute position for which the coordinates * in this reference system is returned. the coordinates for the specified absolute position. ConversionException if a conversion error occurs.
* Returns the absolute position from the coordinates in * this reference system. This update may require information already * supplied by the position. For example, the height for a pressure * altitude might depends upon the latitude/longitude and the time. coordinates the coordinates for which the absolute position * is adjusted. position the position object to update. the corresponding absolute position. ConversionException if a conversion error occurs.
* Returns the OpenGIS coordinate system associated to this * coordinate reference system. the corresponding coordinate system.
* OpenGIS® - Area for which the (coordinate) reference system is valid. coordinate reference system valid area, * or {@code null} (default) if not available.
* OpenGIS® - Description of domain of usage, or limitations of usage, * for which this (coordinate) reference system object is valid.
* OpenGIS® - The primary name by which this object is identified. an identifier holding the class name.
* OpenGIS® - An alternative name by which this object is identified. The aliases, or an empty collection if there is none.
<method type="Collection" name="getAlias" startLine="168" endLine="170" />
* OpenGIS® - An identifier which references elsewhere the object's defining information. * Alternatively an identifier by which this object can be referenced. This object identifiers, or an empty set if there is none.
<method type="Set" name="getIdentifiers" startLine="178" endLine="180" />
* OpenGIS® - Comments on or information about this object, including * data source information. null (default).
* OpenGIS® - Returns a Well Known Text (WKT) for * this object. This operation may fails if an object is too complex for * the WKT format capability (for example an engineering CRS} with different * unit for each axis). The Well Know Text for this object. UnsupportedOperationException If this object can't be formatted * as WKT (default).
<declaration type="Unit" name="getUnit" startLine="233" endLine="235" />
<method type="Collection" name="getAlias" startLine="241" endLine="243" /> <method type="Set" name="getIdentifiers" startLine="245" endLine="247" />
<declaration type="FastSet" name="EMPTY_SET" />
class.comment: General implementation using absolute position as intermediary.
